{"task": {"step_number": 4, "description": "Call peaks for CBX7 binding using the MACS3 tool with the IgGold sample serving as the control. In this step, MACS3 compares the treatment (CBX7) versus the control (IgGold) to identify enriched regions (peaks) indicating CBX7 binding sites. The result is a narrowPeak file that lists the positions and significance of the detected peaks.", "input_filename": ["./data/SRR620206.fastq.gz", "./output/003/aligned_SRR620208.sam", "./data/SRR620204.fastq.gz", "./data/SRR620205.fastq.gz", "./output/003/aligned_dedup_SRR620205.bam", "./data/SRR620208.fastq.gz", "./output/003/trimmed_SRR620205.fastq.gz", "./output/003/trimmed_SRR620208.fastq.gz", "./data/mm39.fa", "./output/003/dedup_metrics_SRR620208.txt", "./output/003/aligned_SRR620205.sam", "./output/003/aligned_dedup_SRR620208.bam", "./output/003/aligned_sorted_SRR620205.bam.bai", "./data/mm39.ncbiRefSeq.gtf", "./output/003/aligned_sorted_SRR620208.bam.bai", "./output/003/aligned_dedup_SRR620205.bam.bai", "./output/003/dedup_metrics_SRR620205.txt", "./output/003/aligned_dedup_SRR620208.bam.bai", "./output/003/aligned_sorted_SRR620208.bam", "./output/003/aligned_dedup_SRR620205.bam: sorted and deduplicated BAM for cbx7", "./output/003/aligned_sorted_SRR620205.bam", "./output/003/aligned_dedup_SRR620208.bam: sorted and deduplicated BAM for IgGold"], "output_filename": ["./output/003/cbx7_peaks.narrowPeak: narrowPeak file of CBX7 binding sites"], "tools": "MACS3"}, "pre debug": [], "result": "/home/agent/miniconda3/envs/agent1/bin/python

", "related_docs": "3. run-bam2pairs.sh:
Bam to pairs conversion module for Hi-C data, based on samtools, bgzip and pairix.
Input : any paired-end bam file
Output : a chromosome-block-sorted and bgzipped pairs pairs file that contains all the mapped read pairs in the bam file, along with its index (.bsorted.pairs.gz and .bsorted.pairs.gz.px2)
Usage
Run the following in the container.
run-bam2pairs.sh <input_bam> <output_prefix>
# input_bam : input bam file.
# output_prefix : prefix of the output pairs file.
Set parameters according to the example:
Suppose the input file is: ./output/GM12878_bwa_sorted_1.bam and ./output/GM12878_bwa_sorted_2.bam, the target is./output/GM12878_bwa_sorted_pairs  and./output/GM12878_bwa_sorted_pairs , Generate the following sample script:
bash ./scripts/run-bam2pairs.sh ./output/GM12878_bwa_sorted_1.bam ./output/GM12878_bwa_sorted_pairs   
bash ./scripts/run-bam2pairs.sh ./output/GM12878_bwa_sorted_2.bam ./output/GM12878_bwa_sorted_pairs 

You can install the tool, but do not do any additional operations.You can install the tool, but do not do any additional operations.Please follow the example to generate rather than copy and paste completely, especially for folder names, file names, etc.

3. run-bam2pairs.sh:
Bam to pairs conversion module for Hi-C data, based on samtools, bgzip and pairix.
Input : any paired-end bam file
Output : a chromosome-block-sorted and bgzipped pairs pairs file that contains all the mapped read pairs in the bam file, along with its index (.bsorted.pairs.gz and .bsorted.pairs.gz.px2)
Usage
Run the following in the container.
run-bam2pairs.sh <input_bam> <output_prefix>
# input_bam : input bam file.
# output_prefix : prefix of the output pairs file.
Set parameters according to the example:
Suppose the input file is: ./output/GM12878_bwa_sorted_1.bam and ./output/GM12878_bwa_sorted_2.bam, the target is./output/GM12878_bwa_sorted_pairs  and./output/GM12878_bwa_sorted_pairs , Generate the following sample script:
bash ./scripts/run-bam2pairs.sh ./output/GM12878_bwa_sorted_1.bam ./output/GM12878_bwa_sorted_pairs   
bash ./scripts/run-bam2pairs.sh ./output/GM12878_bwa_sorted_2.bam ./output/GM12878_bwa_sorted_pairs 

You can install the tool, but do not do any additional operations.You can install the tool, but do not do any additional operations.Please follow the example to generate rather than copy and paste completely, especially for folder names, file names, etc.", "id": "003", "shell": ["conda install -y macs3", "macs3 callpeak -t ./output/003/aligned_dedup_SRR620205.bam -c ./output/003/aligned_dedup_SRR620208.bam -f BAM -g mm -n cbx7_peaks --outdir ./output/003"]}
